docs.title: Datto.DBPool.API PowerShell Module
docs.text:
This PowerShell Module acts as a wrapper for the internal Datto DBPool API.

There is no need to go through a big learning curve spending lots of time working out how to use the Datto DBPool API.

Simply load the module, enter your API key and get results within minutes!

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This Powershell module acts as a wrapper for the Datto DBPool API, and is designed to make it easier to use the internal DBPool API in your PowerShell scripts. As much of the hard work is done, you can develop your scripts faster and be more effecient.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Install PowerShell 7

While not strictly nessicary, installing the latest version of PowerShell 7 (or greater depending on latest version) is highly reccomended.

This module should™ function with the default Windows PowerShell 5.1 though it is encouraged to install the latest version where possible as this has been built and tested against the latest stable release.

First get your personal API key from the DBPool web Url

  • https://dbpool.datto.net/web/self

You will want to store this in a secure location, such as a password manager or other secret store.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Default

This may require to upgrade the default version of PowerShellGet for Windows PowerShell 5.1

Install using PowerShellGet

Install-Module -Name 'Datto.DBPool.API' -Scope CurrentUser -AllowPrerelease

Newer

Install using PowerShellGet v3.0

aka 'PSResourceGet'

Install-PSResource -Name Datto.DBPool.API -Scope CurrentUser -Prerelease

docs.title: Add your API key
docs.text:
Add-DBPoolApiKey

cmdlet Add-DBPoolApiKey at command pipeline position 1
Supply values for the following parameters:
(Type !? for Help.)
apiKey: ************************************

docs.title: Refresh all containers
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolContainerAction -Action refresh -Id (Get-DBPoolContainer).Id -Force

Success: Invoking Action [ restart ] on Container [ ID: 123456 ].
Success: Invoking Action [ restart ] on Container [ ID: 987654 ].
Success: Invoking Action [ restart ] on Container [ ID: 135790 ].
Success: Invoking Action [ restart ] on Container [ ID: 102030 ].

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: The Get-DBPoolContainer function retrieves container information from the DBPool API.

docs.title: ListContainer (Default)
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer [-ListContainer] [[-Id] <Int32[]>] [-Name <String[]>] [-DefaultDatabase <String[]>]
 [-NotLike] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: ParentContainer
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer [-ParentContainer] [[-Id] <Int32[]>] [-Name <String[]>] [-DefaultDatabase <String[]>]
 [-NotLike] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: ChildContainer
docs.text: Get-DBPoolContainer [-ChildContainer] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: ContainerStatus
docs.text: Get-DBPoolContainer [-Id] <Int32[]> [-Status] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text:
This function retrieves container details from the DBPool API.

It can get containers, parent containers, or child containers, and also retrieve containers or container status by ID. This also can filter or exclude by container name or database.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer

Get a list of all containers from the DBPool API

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer -Id 12345

Get a list of containers from the DBPool API by ID

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer -Status -Id @( 12345, 67890 )

Get the status of an array of containers by IDs

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer -ParentContainer

Get a list of parent containers from the DBPool API

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer -ParentContainer -Id 12345

Get a list of parent containers from the DBPool API by ID

docs.title: EXAMPLE 6
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer -ChildContainer

Get a list of child containers from the DBPool API

docs.title: EXAMPLE 7
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer -Name 'MyContainer'
Get-DBPoolContainer -ParentContainer -Name 'ParentContainer*'

Uses 'Where-Object' to get a list of containers from the DBPool API, or parent containers by name Accepts wildcard input

docs.title: EXAMPLE 8
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer -Name 'MyContainer' -NotLike
Get-DBPoolContainer -ParentContainer -Name 'ParentContainer*' -NotLike

Uses 'Where-Object' to get a list of containers from the DBPool API, or parent containers where the name does not match the filter Accepts wildcard input

docs.title: EXAMPLE 9
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer -DefaultDatabase 'Database'
Get-DBPoolContainer -ParentContainer -DefaultDatabase 'Database*'

Get a list of containers from the DBPool API, or parent containers by database Accepts wildcard input

docs.title: EXAMPLE 10
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer -DefaultDatabase 'Database' -NotLike
Get-DBPoolContainer -ParentContainer -DefaultDatabase 'Database*' -NotLike

Get a list of containers from the DBPool API, or parent containers where the database does not match the filter Accepts wildcard input

docs.title: -ListContainer
docs.text:
Retrieves a list of containers from the DBPool API. This is the default parameter set.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: ListContainer
Aliases:

Required: False

Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named

Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Type: SwitchParameter

Aliases:

Required: False

Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Id
docs.text:
The ID of the container details to get from the DBPool. This parameter is required when using the 'ContainerStatus' parameter set.

Type: Int32[]
Parameter Sets: ListContainer, ParentContainer
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

Type: Int32[]
Parameter Sets: ContainerStatus
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Status
docs.text:
Gets the status of a container by ID. Returns basic container details, and dockerContainerRunning, mysqlServiceResponding, and mysqlServiceRespondingCached statuses.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: ContainerStatus
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Name
docs.text:
Filters containers returned from the DBPool API by name. Accepts wildcard input.

Type: String[]
Parameter Sets: ListContainer, ParentContainer
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName)
Accept wildcard characters: True

docs.title: -DefaultDatabase
docs.text:
Filters containers returned from the DBPool API by database. Accepts wildcard input.

Type: String[]
Parameter Sets: ListContainer, ParentContainer
Aliases: Database

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName)
Accept wildcard characters: True

docs.title: -NotLike
docs.text:
Excludes containers returned from the DBPool API by Name or DefaultDatabase using the -NotLike switch. Requires the -Name or -DefaultDatabase parameter to be specified.

Returns containers where the Name or DefaultDatabase does not match the provided filter.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: ListContainer, ParentContainer
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: CommonParameters
docs.text: This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters.

docs.title: [int] -Id
docs.text: The ID of the container to get details for.

docs.title: [string] - Name
docs.text: The name of the container to get details for.

docs.title: [string] - DefaultDatabase
docs.text: The database of the container to get details for.

docs.title: [PSCustomObject]
docs.text: The response from the DBPool API.

docs.title: NOTES
docs.text:
The -Name, and -DefaultDatabase parameters are not native endpoints of the DBPool API. This is a custom function which uses 'Where-Object', along with the optional -NotLike parameter to return the response using the provided filter.

If no match is found an error is output, and the original response is returned.

docs.title: RELATED LINKS
docs.text: https://datto-dbpool-api.kentsapp.com/Containers/Get-DBPoolContainer/

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: The New-DBPoolContainer function is used to create a new container from the DBPool API.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
New-DBPoolContainer [-ContainerName] <String> [-ParentId <Int32>] [-ParentName <String>]
 [-ParentDefaultDatabase <String>] [-Force] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: This function creates a new container in the DBPool based on the provided container name and parent container information. The ContainerName parameter is mandatory, and at least one of the parent parameters (ParentId, ParentName, or ParentDefaultDatabase) must be specified.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
New-DBPoolContainer -ContainerName 'MyNewContainer' -ParentId 12345

This will create a new container named 'MyNewContainer' based on the parent container with ID 12345.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolContainer -ParentContainer -Id 1 | New-DBPoolContainer -ContainerName 'MyNewContainer'

This will create a new container named 'MyNewContainer' based on the piped in parent container.

docs.title: -ContainerName
docs.text:
The name for the new container.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: The Remove-DBPoolContainer function is used to delete a container in the DBPool.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Remove-DBPoolContainer [-Id] <Int32[]> [-Force] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text:
The Remove-DBPoolContainer function is used to delete containers in the DBPool based on the provided container ID.

!! This is a destructive operation and will destory the container !!

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Remove-DBPoolContainer -Id '12345'

This will delete the provided container by ID.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
@( 12345, 56789 ) | Remove-DBPoolContainer -Confirm:$false

This will delete the containers with ID 12345, and 56789.

docs.title: -Id
docs.text:
The ID of the container to delete. This accepts an array of integers.

Type: Int32[]
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: ContainerId

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Force
docs.text:
Forces the removal of the container without prompting for confirmation.

Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: The Rename-DBPoolContainer function is used to update a container in the DBPool.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Rename-DBPoolContainer [-Id] <Int32[]> [-Name] <String> [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: The Rename-DBPoolContainer function is used to change the name a container in the DBPool API.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Rename-DBPoolContainer -Id 12345 -Name 'NewContainerName'

This will update the container with ID 12345 to have the name 'NewContainerName'

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
@( 12345, 56789 ) | Rename-DBPoolContainer -Name 'NewContainerName'

This will update the containers with ID 12345, and 56789 to have the name 'NewContainerName'

docs.title: -Id
docs.text:
The ID of the container to update. This accepts an array of integers.

Type: Int32[]
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: ContainerId

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Name
docs.text:
The new name for the container.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 2
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.text: This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters.

docs.title: [int] - The ID of the container to update.
[string] - The new name for the container.
[PSCustomObject] - The response from the DBPool API.

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: The Invoke-DBPoolContainerAccess function is used to interact with various container access operations in the Datto DBPool API.

docs.title: GetAccess (Default)
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolContainerAccess [-Id] <Int32[]> [-Username] <String[]> [-GetAccess] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: RemoveAccess
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolContainerAccess [-Id] <Int32[]> [-Username] <String[]> [-RemoveAccess] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: AddAccess
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolContainerAccess [-Id] <Int32[]> [-Username] <String[]> [-AddAccess] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: The Invoke-DBPoolContainerAccess function is used to Get, Add, or Remove access to a container in the Datto DBPool API based on a given username.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolContainerAccess -Id '12345' -Username 'John.Doe'
Invoke-DBPoolContainerAccess -Id '12345' -Username 'John.Doe' -GetAccess

This will get access to the container with ID 12345 for the user "John.Doe"

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolContainerAccess -Id @( '12345', '56789' ) -Username 'John.Doe' -AddAccess

This will add access to the containers with ID 12345, and 56789 for the user "John.Doe"

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolContainerAccess -Id '12345' -Username @( 'Jane.Doe', 'John.Doe' ) -RemoveAccess

This will remove access to the container with ID 12345 for the users "Jane.Doe", and "John.Doe"

docs.title: -Id
docs.text:
The ID of the container to access. This accepts an array of integers.

Type: Int32[]
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: ContainerId

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Username
docs.text:
The username to access the container. This accepts an array of strings.

Type: String[]
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 2
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: The Invoke-DBPoolContainerAction function is used to interact with various container action operations in the Datto DBPool API.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolContainerAction [-Action] <String> [-Id] <Int32[]> [-Force] [-TimeoutSeconds <Int32>]
 [-ThrottleLimit <Int32>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: The Invoke-DBPoolContainerAction function is used to perform actions on a container such as refresh, schema-merge, start, restart, or stop.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolContainerAction -Action 'restart' -Id '12345'

This will restart the container with ID 12345

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolContainerAction refresh 12345,56789

This will refresh the containers with ID 12345, and 56789

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolContainerAction -Action refresh -Id (Get-DBPoolContainer).Id -Force

This will refresh all containers without prompting for confirmation.

docs.title: -Action
docs.text:
The action to perform on the container. Valid actions are: refresh, schema-merge, start, restart, or stop.

Start, Stop, and Restart are all considered minor actions and will not require a confirmation prompt.

Refresh and Schema-Merge are considered major actions and will require a confirmation prompt.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Id
docs.text:
The ID(s) of the container(s) to perform the action on.

Type: Int32[]
Parameter Sets: (All)

docs.title: CommonParameters
docs.text: This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters.

docs.title: [int]
docs.text: The ID of the container to perform the action on.

docs.title: [string]
docs.text: The action to perform on the container.

docs.title: [void]
docs.text: No output is returned.

docs.title: NOTES
docs.text:
• Actions:

  • refresh

    • Recreate the Docker container and ZFS snapshot for the container.
  • schema-merge
    • Attempt to apply upstream changes to the parent container to this child container. This may break your container. Refreshing a container is the supported way to update a child container's database schema.

  • start

    • Start the Docker container for the container.

  • restart

    • Stop and start the Docker container.

  • stop

    • Stop the Docker container.

docs.title: RELATED LINKS
docs.text: N/A

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Provides an example exception response from the DBPool API for debugging purposes.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Invoke-DBPoolDebug [[-method] <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Uses the Invoke-DBPoolRequest function to make a request to the DBPool API. Returns an example exception response for debugging and testing purposes.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolDebug -method GET

Sends a 'GET' request to the DBPool API and returns a '418' exception response error.

docs.title: -method
docs.text:
The HTTP method to use when making the request to the DBPool API. Default is 'GET'.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: GET
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

NOTES

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: The Set-DBPoolApiParameter function is used to set parameters for the Datto DBPool API.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Set-DBPoolApiParameter [[-base_uri] <Uri>] [-apiKey] <SecureString> [-Force] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: The Set-DBPoolApiParameter function is used to set the API URL and API Key for the Datto DBPool API.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Set-DBPoolApiParameter

Sets the default base URI and prompts for the API Key.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2

Sets the base URI to https://dbpool.example.com and sets the API Key.

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Checks the availability of the DBPool API using an HTTP HEAD request.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Test-DBPoolApi [[-base_uri] <String>] [[-resource_Uri] <String>] [[-apiKey] <SecureString>]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: This function sends an HTTP HEAD request to the specified API URL using Invoke-WebRequest. Checks if the HTTP status code is 200, indicating that the API is available.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Test-DBPoolApi -base_uri "https://api.example.com"

Checks the availability of the API at https://api.example.com

docs.title: -base_uri
docs.text:
The base URL of the API to be checked.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: $DBPool_Base_URI
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.text:
The URI of the API resource to be checked.

The default value is '/api/docs/openapi.json'.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 2
Default value: /api/docs/openapi.json
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Optional: Access token for authorization.

Parameter Sets: (All)

docs.text: This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters.

docs.title: [string] - The base URI for the DBPool API connection.
[SecureString] - The API key for the DBPool.
[System.Boolean] - Returns $true if the API is available, $false if not.
SYNOPSIS
docs.text:
Converts uri filter parameters

As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any query parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: ConvertTo-DBPoolQueryString [[-uri_Filter] <Hashtable>] [-resource_Uri] <String> [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text:
The ConvertTo-DBPoolQueryString cmdlet converts & formats uri filter parameters from a function which are later used to make the full resource uri for an API call

This is an internal helper function the ties in directly with the Invoke-DBPoolRequest & any public functions that define parameters

As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any query parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
ConvertTo-DBPoolQueryString -uri_Filter $uri_Filter -resource_Uri '/api/v2/containers'

Example: (From public function) $uri_Filter = @{}

ForEach ( $Key in $PSBoundParameters.GetEnumerator() ){
    if( $excludedParameters -contains $Key.Key ){$null}
    else{ $uri_Filter += @{ $Key.Key = $Key.Value } }
}

1x key = https://api.DBPool.com/v1/api/v2/containers?parentId=12345
2x key = https://api.DBPool.com/v1/api/v2/containers?parentId=12345&power=True

docs.title: -uri_Filter
docs.text:
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.

This allows for the full uri query to occur

As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any query parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility

Type: Hashtable
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -resource_Uri
docs.text:
Defines the short resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 2
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Gets various API metadata values

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Get-DBPoolMetaData [[-base_uri] <String>] [[-resource_uri] <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: The Get-DBPoolMetaData cmdlet gets various API metadata values from an Invoke-WebRequest to assist in various troubleshooting scenarios such as rate-limiting.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolMetaData

Gets various API metadata values from an Invoke-WebRequest to assist in various troubleshooting scenarios such as rate-limiting.

The default full base uri test path is: https://dbpool.datto.net

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolMetaData -base_uri http://dbpool.example.com

Gets various API metadata values from an Invoke-WebRequest to assist in various troubleshooting scenarios such as rate-limiting.

The full base uri test path in this example is: http://dbpool.example.com/device

docs.title: -base_uri
docs.text:
Define the base URI for the DBPool API connection using Datto's DBPool URI or a custom URI.

The default base URI is https://dbpool.datto.net

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: $DBPool_Base_URI
Accept pipeline input: True (ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -resource_uri
docs.text:
Define the resource URI for the DBPool API connection.

The default resource URI is /api/v2/self

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)

Required: False
Position: 2
Default value: /api/v2/self
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Internal function to make an API request to the DBPool API

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolRequest [[-method] <String>] [-resource_Uri] <String> [[-uri_Filter] <Hashtable>]
 [[-data] <Hashtable>] [[-DBPool_JSON_Conversion_Depth] <Int32>] [-allPages] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text:
The Invoke-DBPoolRequest cmdlet invokes an API request to DBPool API

This is an internal function that is used by all public functions

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolRequest -method GET -resource_Uri '/api/v2/self' -uri_Filter $uri_Filter

Name Value ---- ----- Method GET Uri https://dbpool.datto.net/api/v2/self Headers {X-App-Apikey = 3feb2b29-919c-409c-985d-e99cbae43a6d} Body

Invoke an API request against the defined resource using any of the provided parameters

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Invoke-DBPoolRequest -method GET -resource_Uri '/api/openapi.json' -uri_Filter $uri_Filter
Name                           Value
----                           -----
Method                         GET
Uri                            https://dbpool.datto.net/api/openapi.json
Headers                        {X-App-Apikey = 3feb2b29-919c-409c-985d-e99cbae43a6d}
Body

Invoke an API request against the defined resource using any of the provided parameters

docs.title: -method
docs.text:
Defines the type of API method to use

Allowed values: 'DEFAULT', 'DELETE', 'GET', 'HEAD', 'PATCH', 'POST', 'PUT'

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: DEFAULT
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -resource_Uri
docs.text:
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 2
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -uri_Filter
docs.text:
Used with the internal function [ ConvertTo-DBPoolQueryString ] to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.

This allows for the full uri query to occur

The full resource path is made with the following data $DBPool_Base_URI + $resource_Uri + ConvertTo-DBPoolQueryString

As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any query parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility

Type: Hashtable
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 3
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -data
docs.text:
Defines the data to be sent with the API request body when using POST or PATCH

Type: Hashtable
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 4
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -DBPool_JSON_Conversion_Depth
docs.text:
Defines the depth of the JSON conversion for the 'data' parameter request body

Type: Int32
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 5
Default value: 5
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -allPages
docs.text:
Returns all items from an endpoint

When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters

As of June 2024, DBPool does not support any paging parameters. This is only provided to allow forward compatibility

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.text: This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters.

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Sets the API key for the DBPool.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Add-DBPoolApiKey [-apiKey] <SecureString> [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text:
The Add-DBPoolApiKey cmdlet sets the API key which is used to authenticate API calls made to DBPool.

Once the API key is defined, the secret key is encrypted using SecureString.

The DBPool API key is retrieved via the DBPool UI at My Profile -> API key

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Add-DBPoolApiKey

Prompts to enter in your personal API key.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Add-DBPoolApiKey -ApiKey $secureString
Read-Host "Enter your DBPool API Key" -AsSecureString | Add-DBPoolApiKey

Sets the API key for the DBPool.

docs.title: -apiKey
docs.text:
Defines your API key for the DBPool.

Type: SecureString
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1

Gets the DBPool API key global variable and returns this as an object with the secret key as a SecureString.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolApiKey -AsPlainText

Gets the DBPool API key global variable and returns this as an object with the secret key as plain text.

The default full base uri test path is: https://dbpool.datto.net/api/v2/self

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2

Test-DBPoolApiKey -base_uri http://dbpool.example.com

The full base uri test path in this example is: http://dbpool.example.com/api/v2/self

docs.text: Add-DBPoolBaseURI [[-base_uri] <String>] [[-instance] <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: The Add-DBPoolBaseURI cmdlet sets the base URI which is later used to construct the full URI for all API calls.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Add-DBPoolBaseURI

The base URI will use https://dbpool.datto.net which is Datto's default DBPool URI.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Add-DBPoolBaseURI -instance Datto

The base URI will use https://dbpool.datto.net which is DBPool's default URI.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Add-DBPoolBaseURI -base_uri http://dbpool.example.com

A custom API gateway of http://dbpool.example.com will be used for all API calls to DBPool's API.

docs.text:

DBPool's URI connection point that can be one of the predefined data centers.

The accepted values for this parameter are: [ DEFAULT ] DEFAULT = https://dbpool.datto.net

Placeholder for other data centers.

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Exports the DBPool BaseURI, API Key, & JSON configuration information to file.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Export-DBPoolModuleSetting [-DBPoolConfPath <String>] [-DBPoolConfFile <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text:
The Export-DBPoolModuleSetting cmdlet exports the DBPool BaseURI, API Key, & JSON configuration information to file.

Making use of PowerShell's System.Security.SecureString type, exporting module settings encrypts your API key in a format that can only be unencrypted with the your Windows account as this encryption is tied to your user principal. This means that you cannot copy your configuration file to another computer or user account and expect it to work.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Export-DBPoolModuleSetting

Validates that the BaseURI, API Key, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's DBPool configuration file located at: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI\config.psd1

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Export-DBPoolModuleSetting -DBPoolConfPath C:\DBPoolAPI -DBPoolConfFile MyConfig.psd1

Validates that the BaseURI, API Key, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's DBPool configuration file located at: C:\DBPoolAPI\MyConfig.psd1

docs.title: -DBPoolConfPath
docs.text:
Define the location to store the DBPool configuration file.

By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: $(Join-Path -Path $home -ChildPath $(if ($IsWindows -or $PSEdition -eq 'Desktop'){"DBPoolAPI"}else{".DBPoolAPI"}) )
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -DBPoolConfFile
docs.text:
Define the name of the DBPool configuration file.

By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: Config.psd1
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: CommonParameters
docs.text: This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters.

docs.title: NOTES

docs.title: RELATED LINKS

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Gets the saved DBPool configuration settings

docs.title: index (Default)
docs.text: Get-DBPoolModuleSetting [-DBPoolConfPath <String>] [-DBPoolConfFile <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: show
docs.text: Get-DBPoolModuleSetting [-openConfFile] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text:
The Get-DBPoolModuleSetting cmdlet gets the saved DBPool configuration settings from the local system.

By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolModuleSetting

Gets the contents of the configuration file that was created with the Export-DBPoolModuleSetting

The default location of the DBPool configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI\config.psd1

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolModuleSetting -DBPoolConfPath C:\DBPoolAPI -DBPoolConfFile MyConfig.psd1 -openConfFile

Opens the configuration file from the defined location in the default editor

The location of the DBPool configuration file in this example is: C:\DBPoolAPI\MyConfig.psd1

docs.title: -DBPoolConfPath
docs.text:
Define the location to store the DBPool configuration file.

By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI

Type: String
Parameter Sets: index
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: $(Join-Path -Path $home -ChildPath $(if ($IsWindows -or $PSEdition -eq 'Desktop'){"DBPoolAPI"}else{".DBPoolAPI"}) )
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -DBPoolConfFile
docs.text:
Define the name of the DBPool configuration file.

By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

Type: String
Parameter Sets: index
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: Config.psd1
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.text:
Opens the DBPool configuration file

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: show
Aliases:

Required: False

Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Imports the DBPool BaseURI, API Key, & JSON configuration information to the current session.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Import-DBPoolModuleSetting [-DBPoolConfPath <String>] [-DBPoolConfFile <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text:
The Import-DBPoolModuleSetting cmdlet imports the DBPool BaseURI, API Key, & JSON configuration information stored in the DBPool configuration file to the users current session.

By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Import-DBPoolModuleSetting

Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-DBPoolModuleSetting cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session.

The default location of the DBPool configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI\config.psd1

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Import-DBPoolModuleSetting -DBPoolConfPath C:\DBPoolAPI -DBPoolConfFile MyConfig.psd1

Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-DBPoolModuleSetting cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session.

The location of the DBPool configuration file in this example is: C:\DBPoolAPI\MyConfig.psd1

docs.title: -DBPoolConfPath
docs.text:
Define the location to store the DBPool configuration file.

By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: $(Join-Path -Path $home -ChildPath $(if ($IsWindows -or $PSEdition -eq 'Desktop'){"DBPoolAPI"}else{".DBPoolAPI"}) )
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -DBPoolConfFile
docs.text:
Define the name of the DBPool configuration file.

By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: Config.psd1
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Removes the stored DBPool configuration folder.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Remove-DBPoolModuleSetting [-DBPoolConfPath <String>] [-andVariables] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text:
The Remove-DBPoolModuleSetting cmdlet removes the DBPool folder and its files. This cmdlet also has the option to remove sensitive DBPool variables as well.

By default configuration files are stored in the following location and will be removed: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Remove-DBPoolModuleSetting

Checks to see if the default configuration folder exists and removes it if it does.

The default location of the DBPool configuration folder is: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Remove-DBPoolModuleSetting -DBPoolConfPath C:\DBPoolAPI -andVariables

Checks to see if the defined configuration folder exists and removes it if it does. If sensitive DBPool variables exist then they are removed as well.

The location of the DBPool configuration folder in this example is: C:\DBPoolAPI

docs.title: -DBPoolConfPath
docs.text:
Define the location of the DBPool configuration folder.

By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\DBPoolAPI

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: $(Join-Path -Path $home -ChildPath $(if ($IsWindows -or $PSEdition -eq 'Desktop'){"DBPoolAPI"}else{".DBPoolAPI"}) )
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -andVariables
docs.text:
Define if sensitive DBPool variables should be removed as well.

By default the variables are not removed.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Gets the DBPool OpenAPI documentation.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Get-DBPoolOpenAPI [[-OpenAPI_Path] <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Gets the OpenAPI json spec for the DBPool API documentation.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolOpenAPI

This will get the OpenAPI json spec for the DBPool API documentation.

The path to the OpenAPI json spec. This defaults to '/api/docs/openapi.json'

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Get a user from DBPool

docs.title: Self (Default)
docs.text: Get-DBPoolUser [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: User
docs.text: Get-DBPoolUser [[-Username] <String[]>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: The Get-DBPoolUser function is used to get a user details from DBPool. Default will get the current authenticated user details, but can be used to get any user details by username.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolUser

This will get the user details for the current authenticated user.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Get-DBPoolUser -username "John.Doe"

This will get the user details for the user "John.Doe".

docs.title: -Username
docs.text:
The username of the user to get details for. This accepts an array of strings.

Type: String[]
Parameter Sets: User
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: [string] - The username of the user to get details for.
NOTES
